intro: Hetaeria ophirensis, commonly known as the red-stemmed bristlegrass, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the grass family, Poaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of many grass species. Hetaeria ophirensis is often found in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and along roadsides. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems, supporting various insect and animal life.
